summary: This document consists of multiple pages of credit card statements from Capital One for a Platinum MasterCard account belonging to Phillip I Williams, showing billing cycles from December 2014 to February 2015. The statements detail transactions, fees, interest charges, and payment information. This document is a series of credit card statements from Capital One for a Platinum MasterCard account belonging to Phillip I Williams, covering billing cycles from February to June 2015. It shows transactions, payments, fees, and interest charges, with the account holder residing in Brooklyn, NY. The document appears to be financial records potentially related to the Epstein case, though no direct connection to Epstein or his associates is evident in this text. This document consists of multiple credit card statements from Capital One for a Platinum MasterCard account belonging to Phillip I Williams, covering billing cycles from June to September 2015. It shows transactions, payments, fees, and interest charges, with the account holder residing in Brooklyn, NY. The document is part of the Epstein case financial records, likely submitted as evidence. This document is a Capital One credit card statement for Phillip I Williams, showing transactions from September 16 to October 15, 2015. It details a balance, minimum payment, and various purchases in New York. This document is a series of Capital One Platinum MasterCard monthly statements for an account holder named Phillip I Williams from Brooklyn, NY, covering January to September 2016. It shows routine credit card transactions, payments, fees, and interest charges, with the account eventually becoming suspended and then closed. The document appears to be part of financial records collected in the Epstein case, though its direct relevance is not stated in the text. This document is a Capital One credit card statement for Phillip I Williams, showing a restricted account with a balance of $235.18 and a minimum payment due of $183.00. The statement includes standard financial disclosures and account terms, with no direct mention of Epstein case activities. This is a Capital One credit card statement for Phillip I Williams, showing a past due balance and interest charges for the billing period October 16 to November 15, 2016.
